rationale: The sentence contains a tense agreement error. 'They are all well' is in present tense, but 'he retire' should be 'he has retired' to maintain tense consistency.

annotation_sentence: He enjoy a lot. Now he can, um, do garden every day. He very happy.
rationale: The sentence contains tense agreement errors. 'He enjoy' should be 'He enjoys' and 'He very happy' should be 'He is very happy' to maintain present tense consistency.

annotation_sentence: Yes, he grow many thing. Vegetables, um... how to say... flowers too.

annotation_sentence: I think Japan first. I never go there, but I hear it is nice.
rationale: The sentence contains a tense agreement error. 'I never go there' should be 'I have never gone there' to maintain present perfect tense consistency.

annotation_sentence: Maybe with friends. It's more fun, yes? We can see many thing together.
